title: Distribution of the workforce across economic sectors in China from 2008 to 2018
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share of the workforce and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Services is gradually increasing, Agriculture is gradually decreasing, Industry is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share of the workforce in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Agriculture, and lastly, 3. Industry.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share of the workforce relative to others with an average of 39.08, and it reached its maximum at 2018 with a value of 46.3.
Followed by Agriculture which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 32.1 Share of the workforce,reaching its highest point  at 2008 with a value of 39.6.
The botommost line, Industry,  has a mean of 28.85, and peaked at 2012.

max_summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 3 lines namely Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis represents Share of the workforce and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Services is gradually increasing, Agriculture is gradually decreasing, Industry is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Agriculture, and lastly, 3. Industry.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share of the workforce relative to others with an average of 39.08, and it reached its maximum at 2018 with a value of 46.3.

Industry mostly had the least Share of the workforce with a mean value of 28.85, which peaked at 2012 with a value of 30.3.
Agriculture reported the lowest Share of the workforce about 26.1 in Year 2018
